author: aggressiveonion
title: Cardacity: a trading card game
description: There is a lack of casual apps/games built on Cardano which will be key in order to attract less technical crowds to the project.

assessments.note:
The proposal problem statement highlight the lack of apps and games based on the Cardano blockchain and propose a solution to develop a "city cards" trading game - based on NTF tokens - that clearly addresses the challenge. The creation of such a game addresses the challenge because it could potentially generate transactions and add value to the ecosystem with a new asset built on top of it, which however remains limited to an aspect of pure entertainment.
The most intriguing part of the idea is related to the fact that the players will be incentivized to trade specific tokens based on categories or real-life events: this mechanism could generate attention on particular NTFs and could keep interest in the game alive: it would be really great to expand this concept and present it in more depth (e.g. by already presenting a detailed incentive mechanism for rarer cards or ADA), in order to have a greater impact on the challenge.

I commend the desire to encourage less technical people into the Cardano ecosystem but I don't feel the proposal currently justifies why this needs to be a blockchain project. There also doesn't appear there is a strong enough hook for the project to pull in users and maintain its staying power. In addition to playable cards it's recommend their be some sort of interface that allows interaction among players and an incentive to keep using the game. A technology capability that only blockchain could provide is a way to make this unique, exciting, and even educational.
assessments.reply: The proposal states some reasons why the project benefits from using blockchain technology. The proposal also states what mechanism would be used to keep players interested (the dynamic events). This feature is even highlighted in the assessment from another reviewer.

assessments.note: Great idea for promoting Cardano Dapps and properly designed this proposal could shine bright. Its the sort of idea that could really engage people and make them want to play. Having common cards means potentially people can collect as much as they wish but the real kicker would be in more exclusive cards to really make this thing fly.

The proposal is for building NFT based trading game with a theme of cities in the world. There is a need for a nice niche game and there is a good probability people might get interested in ownership of their own city or other places of interest.

Unfortunately, apart from the statements about the proposers' experience, there are no clear external references to their experience or work already done.
The costs are indicated only in a generic way, and even if several cost items are indicated, it would be really useful to have a cost breakdown, in order to evaluate better the amount requested. In the proposal is clearly indicated that the fund requested will not be used for the development of the platform and therefore the technical aspects are not mandatory requirements: at the same time it would have been very useful to have some technical specification of the technology/languages involved for the development of website / apps / smart contracts and the architecture in general that will be used for generating tokens, buying, selling and bidding.
All these technical aspects, even if external to the funding, would help to have a much clearer idea of ​​the project in general and its feasibility.

The proposal needs additional information regarding the team and how the project will grow. There are two software programmers mentioned but the individuals are not identified nor relevant experience provided. In addition to the programmers the proposers should consider adding members to address graphics, the interface, and a marketing strategy or explain the team member backgrounds that would cover these sectors.
More information is required on the game dynamics, and thus why this would be an engaging game.

It's difficult to assess the experience of the proposers, specially in the area of blockchain and smart contract development, links to online CV (linkedin) or previous work would inspire more confidence for voters. The overall proposal is well written and clear but is lacking in details, specially in terms of technical implementation of the proposal. There is also no budget breakdown, just allocating the requested funds between the different bullet points mentioned the  "Funding" section would be an improvement . The timeline seems a bit to optimistic, given there's only 2 of you working part-time to build the game from the ground up and you are dependent on a 3rd party to design the cards.

The proposal still needs a fair bit of design and implementation work to achieve success. Its great to see the website up and running and some early designs available. The proposers appear to have the skillset to write the code but may require some assistance with design and marketing aspects.

The proposers have hosted a site and started promoting the NFT Drops on Twitter and other media. With enthusiasm shown, it is possible the proposal will be implemented. However, details regarding who will prepare the complex smart contract for the project are not clear, and the technical capabilities of the proposers are not established.

The proposal provides a detailed plan for the implementation: milestones and time horizon are defined in a clear way. The definition of success is well presented and it is really clear what we should expect as a final product from the proposal.
There is also an hard number set as goal for the number of transactions after 6 months, KPI that will be extremely useful in the future.
The proposal also provides a solution for the main possible difficulty that could encounter: a marketing strategy is presented to face the initial hard step of diffusion and adoption. An in-depth study on this topic (e.g. presentation of puzzle examples for the initial distribution of cards, an example of a social plan for the diffusion of the first giveways, etc.) it would be the key for me to give 5 stars on this criterion.

The project should be more ambitious than just playing cards identifying a place. The proposal does not provide a long term strategy for staying relevant, encouraging users, and keeping the project alive past the kickoff. Goals for scaling up the project as additional users enter the market place should be provided past the 6th month mark. The proposal brings to mind games like Risk and Civilization as does sites for travel enthusiasts who collect attain badges or want travel authentication.
assessments.reply: Long term strategy is stated in the proposal - dynamic events and partnerships with real life events.

assessments.note: To be a successful card game needs work not just on the programming, but also the game dynamics. The proposal currently does not show much though on these, thus it is unlikely to be feasible.

A clear roadmap is presented (even if a bit optimistic, as mentioned above) as well as clear success criteria that would allow the community to follow the progress of the proposal and measure it's impact
Excellent information provided and well presented. There are simply so many more aspects that are still in development that, when added will help complete the potential of this project.

The proposal has clear phases and outcome in each phase however number and type of smart contract required to create a game out of the NFTs is not clear and may need a detailed analysis of the features of the proposed game.

solution: A trading card game where each card represents a city. Players can buy and sell cards with ADA. Dynamic events to make the market move.
experience: 2 software engineers with 10+ combined years of experience at SaaS startups. Blockchain investors and enthusiasts.
